🤖 **LinuxBot Help**

LinuxBot is an AI chatbot Discord app for remote **Linux administration**.

**🚀 How to Use**
> Mention the bot (`@LinuxBot`) *or* reply to one of its messages. The AI will read your natural-language request and decide whether to inspect files, modify them, or run commands.

**🔐 Access Control**
Only members or roles whose IDs are listed in the `ALLOW_IDS` entry of the bot's `.env` file may issue requests. Unauthorized users are ignored.

**🧰 Core Tools (chosen automatically by the AI):**
- 📖 **Read** – list directories, view / tail files, check logs & service status.
- ✏️ **Write** – create / edit / delete files, update configs, manage scripts & cron.
- 🛠️ **Execute** – run shell commands or scripts, manage services & processes.

**⚠️ Important Safety Note**
The bot runs as **root**. Be precise and cautious—avoid casually asking for destructive actions (e.g. wiping data, mass permission changes). For risky tasks, clearly confirm intent.

**✅ Tips**
- Ask clearly: *“Check disk space and summarize any partitions over 80%.”*
- Combine steps: *“Create a script at /usr/local/bin/backup.sh then make it executable.”*
- Let the AI decide tooling—avoid pasting raw shell pipelines unless necessary.

**📎 Links**
GitHub: https://github.com/purinton/linuxbot
Community {#} Purinton DevOps Discord: https://discord.gg/QSBxQnX7PF

Need more detail? Just ask for "more help" or "examples". 🐧
